BitDRoller.RollTokenDescription: Choose your dice pool. Choose your position. Choose your effect.
BitDRoller.RollPartialSuccessPositionCon: You hesitate. Withdraw and try a different approach, or else do it with a minor consequence: a minor complication occurs, you have reduced effect, you suffer lesser harm, you end up in a risky position.
BitDRoller.RollPartialSuccessPositionRis: You do it, but there’s a consequence: you suffer harm, a complication occurs, you have reduced effect, you end up in a desperate position.
BitDRoller.RollPartialSuccessPosition: You do it, but there’s a consequence: you suffer severe harm, a serious complication occurs, you have reduced effect.
BitDRoller.RollFailurePositionControlled: You falter. Press on by seizing a risky opportunity, or withdraw and try a different approach.
BitDRoller.RollFailurePositionRisky: Things go badly. You suffer harm, a complication occurs, you end up in a desperate position, you lose this opportunity.
BitDRoller.RollFailurePositionDesperate: It’s the worst outcome. You suffer severe harm, a serious complication occurs, you lose this opportunity for action.
BitDRoller.RollZeromode: Zero Dice rolled - rolling two dice and taking the lowest
BitDRoller.RollGreatEffectDescription:
You get an exceptional result or an extreme effect.

If this is an engagement roll, you've already overcome the first obstacle and are in a controlled position for whatever is next.

If you're marking faction or healing clocks, mark 5 segments.
BitDRoller.RollStandardEffectDescription:
You get a good result or full effect.

If this is an engagement roll, you start in a controlled position.

If you're marking faction or healing clocks, mark 3 segments.
BitDRoller.RollLimitedEffectDescription:
You get a mixed result or a partial effect.

If this is an engagement roll, you start in a risky position.

If you're marking faction or healing clocks, mark 2 segments.
BitDRoller.RollPoorEffectDescription:
You get a bad result or little effect.

If this is an engagement roll, you start in a desperate position.
Good luck!

If you're marking faction or healing clocks, mark 1 segment.

BitDRoller.defaultDiceCountName: Default Number of Dice to Roll
BitDRoller.defaultDiceCountHint: The number of dice that will start selected in the popup
BitDRoller.defaultPositionHint: The position that will start selected in the popup
BitDRoller.defaultEffectHint: The effect that will start selected in the popup
BitDRoller.backgroundColorHint: The background color of the dice results in the chat messages
